issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The YARN scheduler simulator failed when running Fair Scheduler, due to AbstractYarnScheduler introduced in YARN-1041. The ResourceSchedulerWrapper should inherit AbstractYarnScheduler, instead of implementing ResourceScheduler interface directly.

comments.body:
{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12628678/YARN-1726.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:red}-1 tests included{color}.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  There were no new javadoc warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-tools/hadoop-sls.

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/3095//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/3095//console

This message is automatically generated.

This module is such a maintenance nightmare. I need to find some time to fix it.

In the mean while, can you add a test which could have caught this issue? I don't see any tests where this class gets instantiated.

Thanks, [~vinodkv].
Sure, I'll update a testcase.

A new patch:
(1) Fix the problem because of the AbstractYarnScheduler.
(2) Add testcases for AMSimulator amd NMSimulator.
(3) Update the TestSLSRunner to catch the possible exception from child thread during running. The old testcase cannot work as it cannot catch the child threads' exception.
